isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC), Orifice Tube System, Pre-March 2007 - 3200, 4100, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500, 8600 - DIAGNOSIS AND TROUBLESHOOTING

svcsubsecinfo.para: Diagnosis and troubleshooting of the HVAC system consists of the following steps:

item.para: Diagnosis - identifying the probable causes of the system malfunction by observing diagnostic trouble codes, making physical checks, operating the system, and identifying fault symptoms during operation.
Troubleshooting - Isolating the fault by use of the troubleshooting tables.

A/C System Performance Test - Using test equipment to monitor A/C system parameters during operation. This is done to help identify faults during troubleshooting and to verify correct operation after repairs.

svcsubsecinfo.para: The Diagnosis and Troubleshooting Flow Chart provides an overview of this process.

note.para:
If your attempt to troubleshoot the HVAC system is unsuccessful after performing the procedures contained or referenced in this section, refer to SECTION 20
before calling Technical Services.
